roleset.name: towards the end portion of a time period

role.descr: what lies at the end of a time period

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT-6.

example.name: empty 'it', CXN
example.text: I was scared ; I had already almost passed the bend , but I saw the large front of a car rushing toward me , and by then it was too late to avoid it , so I turned the steering - wheel to the right , and in the end there was no frontal impact .
example.note: Empty 'it' generally indicates the use of this sense. This instance is tricky because of the CXN. The 'to avoid it' phrase could be interpreted as the arg2 of late.02 if the subject were a concrete entity, but here, it's part of the CXN "[too][to avoid it]". This proposition boils down to 'it was late (in the span of time during which events are taking place)'.

example.name: empty 'it', arg2
example.text: It was late in the evening, and I blew that room away.

example.name: both args, clearer example
example.text: His 60th Birthday Party was late in March, and he played bass with lots of well wishers from his musical history.

example.name: Another empty 'it'. No args.
example.text: It's getting late, let's go to bed

roleset.name: tardy
roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT-6.

example.name: both args
example.text: Instead, the presiding officer shall inquire as to why-1 the party was late in responding to the notice of hearing [*-1]
example.arg: in responding to the notice of the hearing

example.name: arg2-destination
example.text: That same day, Puig was late to the ballpark and was fined by Mattingly.

roleset.name: deceased
roleset.note: Added by Julia based on WordNet.

example.name: arg1
example.text: Her husband was late, which made her a widow.
